transcripts.text: The key thing with my process of becoming Noah was to make my features look more like Noah does in the Ark encounter.  And Doug had mentioned that he needed to age my skin and to try to put wrinkles on my skin.

Just getting to do the subtle old age makeup on Adam, who played Noah, that was really fun, getting to know him.  It's kind of a lengthy process, and when it's done, hopefully nobody even notices that anything was done to him, but it's age spots, it's layers of plastic that make it so that his skin will wrinkle.  He has incredibly smooth skin for his age, which is not ideal for someone like myself who wants to take this guy and make him several decades older.
And I had to have my face contorted into different positions just to give me as many wrinkles as possible.  And then he sprayed, I think it was some kind of paint on me to give me age spots.

So there's a lot of testing that led up to these things that on location are very simple.  Very time efficient.  This particular technique was so durable he could sleep in it and we could use it the next day with minimal touch up.  And normally, the normal techniques you would use to do that, you would be doing those same type of touch ups halfway through the day.  It just doesn't hold up that well.  In the makeup industry, this gave us what we refer to as bulletproof.  Very tough, durable, waterproof, sweat proof, and it just lasted for a really long time.

Doug Henderson was marvelous.  And I had to get up early.  I had to be there at four in the morning to get my makeup put on.  He spent over an hour just to make me look old and wrinkly.  So it took some time, but Doug was, I mean, just like I said, all the staff, Doug and Kathy Henderson were wonderful.  Everybody there who helped out just really have a servant's heart, and so it really made it pleasurable.  There was always patience and time, and I enjoyed the conversations.  The time went well.  I thought I'd be more tired than I was, but we seemed to have the energy of what do we need to do to get it done.  Thank you.
